summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2020 between attorney Gloria Allred and a federal prosecutor regarding logistical arrangements for Epstein victims to observe the bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss access to a private audio line and in-person video feed, and reveal that Allred has been retained by additional victims who allege abuse by Maxwell.

events.title: Bail Hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Scheduled bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell following her arrest. The hearing was to be conducted with a live audio feed and a limited-capacity video feed due to COVID-19 protocols.

keyFacts: Attorney Gloria Allred was representing multiple victims of Jeffrey Epstein in July 2020, some of whom also alleged victimization by Ghislaine Maxwell.
Allred's clients were initially unwilling to speak to federal prosecutors about their experiences with Maxwell, as of July 2020.
Logistical challenges due to COVID-19 limited public access to Maxwell's bail hearing, prompting special arrangements for victims to observe via a private phone line or in-person video feed.
The email chain reveals coordination between victim attorneys and the U.S. Attorney's office to facilitate victim attendance and observation of court proceedings.
A victim initially planned to fly to New York for the hearing with a support person but later decided not to attend in person.
